frameDefinitions: An Experiencer has an emotion as caused by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1)
A Captor ends the captivity or inhibition of the motion of a Theme from the Location_of_confinement.
A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.
An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.
A former Member of a Group ceases to be a member as a result of the action of an Authority within the Group.
frameExamples: I fall asleep hours later to the sound of their <t>engrossed</t> murmuring.
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
They <t>released</t> me from prison on New Year's Day.
I saw that several men in dark suits had <t>removed</t> all of the evidence from the scene.
The priest <t>excommunicated</t> Henry from the church.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The Time when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is has a feeling about the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
The <fen>Captor</fen> is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen>. The release of the <fen>Theme</fen> is in accord with the plans of the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object in motion released by the <fen>Captor</fen>.
The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
The <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Captor</fen> release the <fen>Theme</fen> .
The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a created entity.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
Theme is the object that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before it changes location.
The non-Agentive cause of the removing event.
The time at which the removal takes place.
The location where the removal takes place.
The person who used to belong to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
An empowered subset of the <fen>Group</fen> which decides to expel its former <fen>Member</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
The Place where the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
listRoleExamples: She petitioned unsuccessfully for their release <fex>from Chateau D'If</fex>.
'Aren't you going to release us <fex>here</fex>?' she asked.
<fex>The waiter</fex> removed the dishes from the table.
The waiter removed <fex>the dishes</fex> from the table.
The waiter removed the dishes <fex>from the table</fex>.
<fex>The raging fire</fex> quickly emptied the square of all people.
<fex>That year</fex> they drained the swamp-water out of Higgs' bottomland.
You just take the dishes and rinse them <fex>in the kitchen</fex>, okay?
I 'm afraid that <fex>I</fex> was expelled from the Society after they found I endorsed him.
Giles bemoaned his expulsion <fex>from the Future Farmers of America</fex>
